Title: Differential connectivity of inferotemporal area TE with the amygdala and the hippocampus in the monkey

@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Citation:
"The hippocampal formation contains the dentate gyrus (DG), the hippocampus proper (fields (CA1-4), the prosubiculum (PoS), and the subiculum (S) (Figure 13.1)." (p. 132)
"Following  WGA-HRP injections into TEav and TEpv, labeled cells and terminals were seen in all the parahippocampal areas: the presubiculum (PrS), parasubiculum (PaS), entorhinal cortex (EC), prorhinal cortex (PR), perirhinal cortex, and areas TF and TH (Figure 13.1)." (pp. 132-133)
"...injections into one of four different regions within area TE: the anterodorsal (TEad), posterodorsal (TEpd), anteroventral (TEav), or posteroventral (TEpv) regions (Figure 13.1A)" (p. 130)
"...Furthermore, the connections between the TEd region and amygdala, and between the TEv region and hippocampus or parahippocampal areas, were stronger in the anterior portion of area TE (TEa; TEad+TEav) than in its posterior one (TEp; TEpd + TEpv)." (p. 133)

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "The hippocampal formation contains the dentate gyrus (DG), the hippocampus proper (fields (CA1-4), the prosubiculum (PoS), and the subiculum (S) (Figure 13.1). ...The labeling in field CA1 was localized in th ezone corresponding to subfield CA1a after WGA-HRP injections into TEav and TEpv, but were not observed anywhere in th ehippocampus after injections into TEad or TEpd (Figure 13.1)." (p. 132)
@InterMapRelations.Comments: It is not stated from which parcellation has been used, but it seems that it equals that of Lorente de Nó (1934), because L34 has been used for the description of label in subfield CA1.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "It is well known that severe impairment of visual memory is caused by lesions of inferotemporal area TE [1] as well by combined amygdalo-hippocampal lesions.[2,3]" (p. 129) [1= Bonin and Bailey, 1947]

@Methods.Comments:
It was said that 5 japanese and 2 rhesus monkeys were used. It is additionally said that not only WGA-HRP, but also free HRP was used.
Unfortunately,  it is not clearly stated if for the two macaque species both tracer substances were used or not.

@Methods_Animals.Comments: 5 Macaca fuscata and 2 Macaca mulatta were used.

@Methods.Comments:
It was said that 5 japanese and 2 rhesus monkeys were used. It is additionally said that not only WGA-HRP, but also free HRP was used.
Unfortunately,  it is not clearly stated if for the two macaque species both tracer substances were used or not.

@Injections.Citation: "...injections into one of the four regions within area TE: the anterodorsal (TEad), posterodorsal (TEpd), anteroventral (TEav), or posteroventral (TEpv) regions (Figure 13.1A). The dorso-ventral demarcation was the anterior middle temporal sulcus (amt) and its caudal extension, and the anterior-posterior border was a vertical line crossing the tip of the amt (Figure 13.1A)." (p. 130)

"...injections into one of the four regions within area TE: the anterodorsal (TEad), posterodorsal (TEpd), anteroventral (TEav), or posteroventral (TEpv) regions (Figure 13.1A). The dorso-ventral demarcation was the anterior middle temporal sulcus (amt) and its caudal extension, and the anterior-posterior border was a vertical line crossing the tip of the amt (Figure 13.1A)." (p. 130)

"...injections into one of the four regions within area TE: the anterodorsal (TEad), posterodorsal (TEpd), anteroventral (TEav), or posteroventral (TEpv) regions (Figure 13.1A). The dorso-ventral demarcation was the anterior middle temporal sulcus (amt) and its caudal extension, and the anterior-posterior border was a vertical line crossing the tip of the amt (Figure 13.1A)." (p. 130)

"...injections into one of the four regions within area TE: the anterodorsal (TEad), posterodorsal (TEpd), anteroventral (TEav), or posteroventral (TEpv) regions (Figure 13.1A). The dorso-ventral demarcation was the anterior middle temporal sulcus (amt) and its caudal extension, and the anterior-posterior border was a vertical line crossing the tip of the amt (Figure 13.1A)." (p. 130)

@Methods_Animals.Comments: 5 Macaca fuscata and 2 Macaca mulatta were used.

publication.title: Differential connectivity of inferotemporal area TE with the amygdala and the hippocampus in the monkey
